document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
marcida Coquillett (1893b:224
key, 228 male desc.),
Aldrich (1905:247
cat.),
Kröber (1912: 222
male key, 229 spec. list;

subSubSection.paragraph: 1913:32 dist., 38 male key; 1914: 38 male key, 44 desc.), Cole (1923a:69 desc., 70 dist., Figs. 56 fem. frons, 79 ant.,

(
1981a:240 comb. change, spec. list) (
Arenigena
). Type locality USA , Arizona , Oracle. Holotype female in USNM
(Type No. 26020). New synonym.

The holotype female of
Psilocephala brunnea Kröber
was compared with females of
Arenigena marcida
and found to be conspecific based on the characteristics of the female furca.

Diagnosis.
Arenigena marcida
is similar to
A. bajaensis
in having the inner gonocoxal process (Fig. 82) narrow, elongate and the distiphallus (Fig. 86) thick basally and broadly curved posteroventrally. It differs from
A. bajaensis
in the male frons lacking setae; the female frons having short, reddish brown setae; the distiphallus (Fig. 84) broadly expanded laterally; and the furca (Fig. 87) with the anterior margin narrow.
Description of MALE. Variation (n=10).
Body length 7.0–9.4, 8.0 mm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 72–79.
Arenigena floridensis .
72. Tergite 8, epandrium, cerci. 73. Sternite 8, gonocoxite ventral view. 74. Gonocoxite, lateral view. 75. Gonostylus lateral view. 76. Aedeagus, dorsal view. 77. Aedeagus, ventral view. 78. Aedeagus, lateral view. 79. Female internal reproductive organs.

subSubSection.paragraph:
FIGURES 80–87.
Arenigena marcida .
80. Tergite 8, epandrium, cerci. 81. Sternite 8, gonocoxite ventral view. 82. Gonocoxite, lateral view. 83. Gonostylus lateral view. 84. Aedeagus, dorsal view. 85. Aedeagus, ventral view. 86. Aedeagus, lateral view. 87. Female internal reproductive organs. Scale = 0.1 mm .

Head. Length 0.84–1.16, 0.95 mm . Ocellar tubercle dark reddish brown, pubescence gray, dense; setae dark reddish brown, short. Frons pubescence white to pale gold, dense; setae absent. Antenna yellow, second and third flagellomeres dark brown; antenna/head length 0.54–0.78, 0.58; scape length 0.16–0.22, 0.19 mm , width 0.12–0.18, 0.14 mm , length/width 1.1–1.6, 1.3, scape/pedicel length 1.6–3.1, 2.4, scape/flagellum width 0.7–1.0, 0.8, setae pale yellow to yellowish brown, short; pedicel length 0.07–0.10, 0.08 mm , width 0.12–0.16, 0.14 mm , length/width 0.4–0.7, 0.6; flagellum (narrow apical portion of first flagellomere short), length 0.30–0.44, 0.37 mm , width 0.16–0.22, 0.14 mm , length/width 1.7–2.7, 2.0, flagellum/scape length 1.6–2.3, 2.0. Parafacial pubescence yellowish gray. Gena pubescence whitish gray; setae white, elongate. Maxillary palpus yellow; length 0.32–0.48, 0.40 mm , width 0.06 mm , length/width 5.3–8.0, 6.7; setae white to pale yellow, elongate. Occipital setae white, elongate white, abundant dorsally.

Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1–2, dc. Mesonotum pubescence gray, dense; setae white, elongate. Pleuron pubescence gray, dense; setae white, elongate on propleuron, proepimeron (occasionally absent), anepisternum, katepisternum (sparse, variable, in anterodorsal and anteroventral patch, in mediodorsal patch, or in narrow band along anterior margin), laterotergite, metanepisternum, and scutellum. Wing. Membrane pale whitish gray, veins and cross-veins brown with brown spot at fork of R 4+5 , r-m, apex of discal cell, apex of cells bm and cup ; length 5.3–7.0, 6.2 mm , width 2.0–2.5, 2.2 mm , length/width 2.3–3.1, 2.7; pterostigma dark brown. Legs. Coxae pubescence white, dense; setae white, elongate. Femora dark reddish brown, pubescence white; ventral setae white, elongate, dorsal setae white, appressed. Tibiae yellow. Tarsi 1 dark yellow; 2–5 brown.

Abdomen. Pubescence white, dense; dorsal setae white, elongate, erect, abundant; lateral setae white, elongate.
Terminalia
(MEI 113211) brown. Tergite 8 (Fig. 80), setae pale yellow. Sternite 8 (Fig. 81), rectangular, sides rounded, posterior margin slightly emarginate; setae pale yellow, separated medially on posterior margin. Epandrium (Fig. 80), posterolateral margin extended, pointed; setae yellow. Hypoproct (Fig. 80), posterior margin slightly emarginate. Gonocoxite ventral view (Fig. 81), posterior margin rounded, setae yellow, macrosetae absent; lateral view (Fig. 82), posterior margin rounded, inner gonocoxal process narrow, elongate. Gonostylus lateral view (Fig. 83), sinuate. Aedeagus with dorsal apodeme (Fig. 84) broadly rounded laterally, anterior margin emarginate; ventral apodeme (Fig. 85), broad; distiphallus dorsal view (Fig. 83) broad basally, tapered posteriorly; lateral view (Fig. 86) thick basally, extending posterior in broad curve; ejaculatory apodeme (Figs. (84–85) not reaching anterior margin of dorsal apodeme.
FEMALE . Similar to male except for following. Variation (n=10).
Body length 7.8–10.4, 9.4 mm .

Head. Length 0.96–1.20, 1.07 mm . Frons pubescence yellowish gray; setae reddish brown, short, scattered. Antenna/head length 0.59–0.70, 0.63; scape length 0.16–0.24, 0.21 mm , width 0.14–0.18, 0.17 mm , length/width 0.9–1.6, 1.3, scape/pedicel length 1.6–3.0, 2.5, scape/flagellum width 0.7–1.0, 0.8; pedicel length 0.08–0.12, 0.09 mm , width 0.14–0.18, 0.16 mm , length/width 0.5–0.6, 0.5; flagellum length 0.34–0.44, 0.39 mm , width 0.16–0.24, 0.21 mm , length/width 1.7–2.5, 1.9, flagellum/scape length 1.7–2.1, 1.9. Maxillary palpus length 0.34–0.52, 0.43 mm , width 0.06–0.08, 0.07 mm , length/width 5.0–7.7, 6.0.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 dc. Wing. Length 6.3–7.8, 6.8 mm , width 2.2–3.0, 2.5 mm , length/width 2.5–3.3, 2.8.

Abdomen. Pale orange brown, pubescence light whitish gray; dorsal setae on tergites 1–4 white, appressed, tergites 5–8 dark reddish brown.
Terminalia
(MEI 109201) reddish brown. Furca (Fig. 87) quadrate; length 0.50 mm , width 0.34 mm ; anterolateral projection short.
Immature stages. Unknown.

Distribution.
Arenigena marcida
is known from Mexico ( Baja California Norte, Baja California Sur , Sinaloa ) and the United States ( Arizona , California , Nevada , New Mexico , Texas ) ( Fig. 97 ).

Habitats and Phenology.
Arenigena marcida
has been hand-netted or sweep-netted in sandy creek bottoms and collected in pit traps, Malaise traps (in coastal sage scrub), ethylene glycol intercept traps, and at mercury vapor and blacklights. Adults have been collected from February through November.

Specimens examined. Type specimens. Two male syntypes of
Psilocephala marcida Coquillett
were examined. One male is labeled "Los Angeles Co., Cal., Collection Coquillett" USNM Type No. 10415 (MEI 141533) and the other is labeled "San Diego Co. CAL., Collection Coquillett" USNM Type No. 10415 (MEI 141547). The male from Los Angeles County (MEI 141533) is designated as the lectotype . This lectotype is designated in order to fix the concept of
Psilocephala marcida Coquillett
and to ensure universal and consistent interpretation of the same. The specimen from San Diego County ( MEI14147 ) is designated as a Paralectotype . The holotype female of
Psilocephala brunnea Kröber
(MEI 112374) is labeled "Oracle, 29.6 Ar, Coll Hubbard & Schwarz" and is in the USNM (Type No. 26020). Other specimens .
